intro: Sideroxylon sarcocarpum, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized tree native to tropical Africa, characterized by its dense, hard wood and thick, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsules that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and economic purposes in its native range.
